answers.text:
Hi Gregory, 
Thank you for your question on 311 systems. We have some documents on the Knowledge Network which your member will hopefully find useful. 
Here is a survey which ICMA did a few years ago on local governments on 311 systems in local governments. Your member may be able to use this survey as a bench marking tool for comparing their new 311 system to the average of those surveyed. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/663
There are also many case studies on 311 systems on the Knowledge Network which may help show how to measure effectiveness or provide ideas on how they can be tested. 
icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/302283
icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/302283
icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/381
In addition to these documents I would encourage your member to create a profile on the Knowledge Network and try joining groups related to 311 technology and check out the 311 topic page. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/groups#GroupTabs=MostActive
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/Topic/1/311CRM_Systems
I hope your member finds these resources helpful!
Best, 
Robin Saywitz
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Gregory Stopka
text:
I have a member that has an established 911 dispatch center.  He is looking for examples on how to survey its effectiveness and how those participating perceive it.  Any examples of surveys would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks,
Greg Stopka
Central Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
title: Surveying 911 Dispatch
